description: Number of double-free subsets of {1, 2, ..., n}.
comments: A set is double-free if it does not contain both x and 2x.
references: Wang, E. T. H. ``On Double-Free Sets of Integers.'' Ars Combin. 28, 97-100, 1989.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..400
S. R. Finch, Triple-Free Sets of Integers
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Double-Free Set.
formula: a(n+1)=a(n)*Fib(b(2n)+2)/Fib(b(2n)+1), Fib = A000045, b = A007814.a(n) = 2^n - A088808(n). - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 19 2003
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = (b = IntegerExponent[2n, 2]; a[n-1]*Fibonacci[b+2]/Fibonacci[b+1]); a[1]=2; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 34}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Oct 10 2012, from first formula *)
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
extensions: Extended with formula by _Christian G. Bower_, Sep 15 1999
